body: $BB This is quite disturbing if your long BlackBerry. Their finally putting the antiquated smartphone and watch to bed in favor of QNX software that $F used in their late 90’s vehicles. I personally don’t think the smartphone thing is dead, just look at 3 trillion dollar $AAPL and $GOOG @TrollingBaggies @TrollingBaggies3 https://www.thestreet.com/investing/blackberry-devices-phones-go-dark-on-january-4 https://www.thestreet.com/investing/blackberry-devices-phones-go-dark-on-january-4

links.title: Blackberry Devices, Phones Go Dark on January 4
links.description: It's not going to be a very happy new year for people still using phones or tablets run on Blackberry's phones. That would include BlackBerry 7.1 OS and earlier, BlackBerry 10 software, and BlackBerry PlayBook OS 2.1 and earlier versions.

links.title: Is Bluetooth holding back Apple's AirPods? We asked the man who made them
links.description: First, a qualification: Gary Geaves isn't quite "the man who made the AirPods", and I'm sure he'd never describe himself as such. He is, though, the fabulously enthusiastic VP of Acoustics at Apple, and he leads the team that's largely responsible for their design.
